title: The successive visibility of the church of which the Protestants are the soundest members I. defended against the opposition of Mr. William Johnson, II. proved by many arguments / by Richard Baxter ; whereunto is added 1. an account of my judgement to Mr. J. how far hereticks are or are not in the church, 2. Mr. Js. explication of the most used terms, with my queries thereupon, and his answer and my reply, 3. an appendix about successive ordination, 4. letters between me and T.S., a papist, with a narrative of the success.
author: Baxter, Richard, 1615-1691.
publisher: Printed by R.W. for Nevil Simmons ... and are to be sold by Francis Tyton ...,
notes: "The second part," "Mr. Johnson's explication of some of the most used terms," and "A letter written to Thomas Smith, a papist," have special title pages.
Errata on p. [8] at end of first part.
Reproduction of original in British Library.
